Free PDF Merge Tool - Combine Multiple PDFs Online

Merge multiple PDF files into a single document instantly with our free online PDF merger. Combine PDFs in any order, rearrange pages, and create professional documents - all without uploading files to any server. Perfect for combining contracts, invoices, reports, and presentations.

How to Merge PDF Files

Step 1: Click "browse" or drag and drop your PDF files into the upload area. You can select multiple files at once.

Step 2: Reorder the PDFs by clicking the up/down arrows to arrange them in your desired sequence.

Step 3: Click the "Merge PDFs" button to combine all files into one document.

Step 4: Download your merged PDF file immediately.

Frequently Asked Questions About PDF Merging

Is it safe to merge PDFs using this online tool?

Absolutely! This PDF merger is completely client-side - all processing happens locally in your web browser using JavaScript libraries. Your PDF files are never uploaded to our servers, never transmitted over the internet, and we never see or store your documents. It's 100% private and secure.

How many PDF files can I merge at once?

There's no hard limit on the number of PDFs you can merge. However, very large files or many files may require more processing time and memory. Most users can easily combine 10-20 PDFs without any issues.

Will merging PDFs reduce quality or file size?

No quality loss occurs when merging PDFs. The merged output maintains the exact quality of the original files. The final file size will be approximately the sum of all individual PDF file sizes.

Can I rearrange the order of PDFs before merging?

Yes! Use the up and down arrow buttons next to each file to reorder them. Arrange your PDFs in exactly the order you want them to appear in the final merged document.

Can I merge password-protected PDFs?

This tool works best with unprotected PDFs. If you have password-protected PDFs, use our PDF Unlock Tool to remove the password first, then merge them.
